intro: Cleome sesquiorygalis, commonly known as the spider flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellow or white flowers that resemble spiders, giving it its common name. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Cleome sesquiorygalis is an annual plant that blooms from summer to fall, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
